intro: Struthanthus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
